title: Studying Together in the Library
caption: This is collaborative learning in action. Focus: clear description, cautious inference, and TOEFL practice.

image.alt: Three students smile while studying with open books at a library table.

fullDescription.en: This is collaborative learning in action. The students exchange ideas and clarify information by working side-by-side. The library setting provides a quiet, focused atmosphere, while their expressions suggest the session is productive and supportive rather than stressful. Their open books and close posture indicate active engagement, like summarizing key points, solving questions, and dividing tasks.

descriptions.advanced: This is collaborative learning in action. The students exchange ideas and clarify information by working side-by-side. The library setting provides a quiet, focused atmosphere, while their expressions suggest the session is productive and supportive rather than stressful. Their open books and close posture indicate active engagement, like summarizing key points, solving questions, and dividing tasks. In this setting (library study area), focus on precise visual evidence before adding careful inference about intent or context. You can highlight actions such as studying; reading and explain how they shape the interaction or outcome. Use specific nouns and modifiers for details like open books; notebooks to improve clarity. Tone words (for example: motivated; friendly) help your response sound natural yet academic. You will practice academic vocabulary and structured responses for TOEFL speaking and writing tasks.

sceneNotes: Focus on what you can SEE (people, setting, actions).
- Simple: Mostly Present Continuous (am/is/are + V-ing) + basic 'There is/There are' for objects.
- Intermediate: Adds prepositional phrases (at/on/near), quantifiers (several/a few/a lot of), and 1 relative clause (who/that/where).
- Advanced: Adds inference language (probably/likely/might), contrast/linkers (while/whereas/in addition), and optional passive voice when relevant.

Use at least 2 collocations in your speaking/writing.

scenarios.title: A memory
scenarios.en: Last weekend, I found myself in library study area. Three students study side by side with open books in a quiet library. At first, I noticed open books, notebooks, library shelves and the way people were studying. Then I looked closer: their clothing (casual student clothing) and their expressions made the scene feel motivated, friendly, productive. After that, something small happened that changed the mood, and we had to respond quickly. In the end, we solved it, and the moment became a story I still remember.
scenarios.fa: آخرِ هفته‌ی قبل library study area بودم. Three students study side by side with open books in a quiet library. اول open books، notebooks و library shelves را دیدم و اینکه آدم‌ها چطور studying. بعد دقیق‌تر نگاه کردم: لباس‌ها (casual student clothing) و حالت چهره‌ها باعث شد فضا motivated، friendly و productive به نظر برسد. بعدش یک اتفاق کوچک افتاد که حال‌وهوا را عوض کرد و مجبور شدیم سریع واکنش نشان بدهیم. آخرش حلش کردیم و همان لحظه تبدیل شد به خاطره‌ای که هنوز یادم می‌ماند.

grammarUsed.en: Past simple with time marker (last weekend) and sequencing (at first/then/after that/in the end).
grammarUsed.fa: گذشته ساده با قید زمان و ترتیب رخدادها (اول/بعد/بعدش/آخرش).

en.tense: Past Simple (V2) to tell a short memory, plus sequencing words (first/then/finally).
sentenceStructure: Time markers: yesterday / last week / a few minutes ago.
howToBuild: Start with a time phrase: Yesterday, Last weekend, A few minutes ago…
Change the main action into past simple (reviewed, chose, played…).
Use sequencing words to make a clear story: first, then, after that, finally.
End with a result or feeling: Everyone felt… / It turned out…
examples: Yesterday, they studied.
Then, they checked open books and continued.
Finally, they felt motivated about the outcome.

fa.tense: گذشته ساده (Past Simple) برای تعریف یک خاطره کوتاه، همراه با کلمات ترتیب‌دهنده (first/then/finally).
sentenceStructure: عبارات زمانی: yesterday / last week / a few minutes ago
howToBuild: با یک عبارت زمانی شروع کن: Yesterday, Last weekend, A few minutes ago…
فعل اصلی را به گذشته ساده تبدیل کن (reviewed, chose, played…).
از کلمات ترتیب‌دهنده استفاده کن: first, then, after that, finally.
با نتیجه یا حس تمام کن: Everyone felt… / It turned out…
examples: دیروز، They studied.
بعد، They open books را بررسی کرد و ادامه داد.
در نهایت، آن‌ها درباره نتیجه motivated بودند.

scenarios.title: Reflection
scenarios.en: Over the past few months, I have started paying attention to scenes like this. I have noticed that details such as open books, notebooks, library shelves are not background; they guide the story. I have also learned how actions like reading can signal feelings such as motivated, friendly, productive. Since then, I have taken more time to observe before I speak, and my descriptions have become clearer and more specific.
scenarios.fa: در چند ماه گذشته شروع کرده‌ام به صحنه‌هایی مثل این بیشتر دقت کنم. متوجه شده‌ام جزئیاتی مثل open books، notebooks و library shelves فقط «پس‌زمینه» نیستند؛ آن‌ها مسیر داستان را تعیین می‌کنند. همچنین یاد گرفته‌ام کارهایی مثل reading چطور می‌تواند احساساتی مثل motivated، friendly و productive را نشان بدهد. از آن زمان بیشتر قبل از حرف زدن مشاهده می‌کنم و توصیف‌هایم واضح‌تر و دقیق‌تر شده است.

grammarUsed.en: Present perfect to connect past learning to the present, plus since/over the past to frame experience.
grammarUsed.fa: حال کامل برای وصل کردن یادگیری گذشته به حال، همراه با «در چند ماه گذشته/از آن زمان».

en.tense: Present Perfect (have/has + past participle) to connect past experience to the present; use since/for/already/yet.
howToBuild: Say what has happened up to now (experience/result).
Use since (a starting point) or for (a duration).
Add a contrast or reflection: however, although, even though.
Finish with what they are doing now (present continuous) if needed.
examples: They have already handled similar situations before.
They have learned to stay motivated in library study area.
Although it looks routine, the details have mattered.

fa.tense: حال کامل (have/has + شکل سوم فعل) برای ربط دادن گذشته به حال؛ همراه با since/for/already/yet.
howToBuild: بگو تا همین الآن چه تجربه/نتیجه‌ای اتفاق افتاده.
از since (نقطه شروع) یا for (مدت زمان) استفاده کن.
یک جمله‌ی بازتاب/تضاد اضافه کن: however, although, even though.
اگر لازم شد با یک جمله حال استمراری وضعیت الآن را بگو.
examples: They قبلاً موقعیت‌های مشابهی را تجربه کرده است.
They یاد گرفته است در library study area motivated بماند.
اگرچه کار روتین به نظر می‌رسد، جزئیات مهم بوده‌اند.

scenarios.title: A challenge
scenarios.en: If we were to replay this moment in library study area, one small change could create a big problem. If open books, notebooks had been missing or damaged, we would have had to improvise. Someone might have said, “We should slow down and check,” and another person could have replied that we were running out of time. In a situation like this, we should prioritize safety and clarity, even if it means changing the plan. If I had ignored those details, I might have misunderstood the whole scene.
scenarios.fa: اگر قرار بود این لحظه در library study area دوباره تکرار شود، یک تغییر کوچک می‌توانست یک مشکل بزرگ بسازد. اگر open books و notebooks نبود یا آسیب دیده بود، مجبور می‌شدیم بداهه تصمیم بگیریم. ممکن بود کسی بگوید «باید آهسته‌تر برویم و بررسی کنیم» و نفر دیگری جواب بدهد که وقت کم داریم. در چنین موقعیتی بهتر است ایمنی و شفافیت را در اولویت بگذاریم، حتی اگر مجبور شویم برنامه را تغییر بدهیم. اگر آن جزئیات را نادیده می‌گرفتم، شاید کل صحنه را اشتباه می‌فهمیدم.

grammarUsed.en: Conditionals for hypotheticals, modals for advice/possibility, and short reported speech (might have said/could have replied).
grammarUsed.fa: شرطی‌ها برای موقعیت فرضی، افعال کمکی برای امکان/پیشنهاد، و نقل‌قول غیرمستقیم برای بازگویی گفت‌وگو.

en.tense: Mixed grammar for higher-level storytelling: conditionals, modals (might/must), and reported speech.
sentenceStructure: Second conditional: If + past simple, would + base verb.
Third conditional: If + had + V3, would have + V3.
Modals of deduction: might/must/can't + base verb.
Reported speech: He said (that) … / She asked if …
howToBuild: Describe the challenge and add a hypothetical solution (If…, would…).
Use modals to infer causes from the photo (They might…, It must…).
Add reported speech for realism: Someone said that…
Finish with a consequence or lesson learned.
examples: If they had checked open books earlier, they would have avoided a mistake.
They might be under pressure, but they must stay motivated.
The supervisor said that every detail mattered.

fa.tense: گرامر ترکیبی سطح بالا: شرطی‌ها، افعال کمکی (might/must) و نقل قول غیرمستقیم (reported speech).
sentenceStructure: شرطی نوع دوم: If + past simple, would + فعل ساده.
شرطی نوع سوم: If + had + V3, would have + V3.
نقل قول غیرمستقیم: He said (that)… / She asked if…
howToBuild: چالش را بگو و یک راه‌حل فرضی اضافه کن (If…, would…).
با مدال‌ها درباره علت‌ها حدس بزن (might/must).
برای واقعی‌تر شدن از reported speech استفاده کن.
در پایان نتیجه یا درسِ داستان را بگو.
examples: اگر They زودتر open books را چک کرده بود، اشتباه را جلوگیری می‌کرد.
ممکن است تحت فشار باشند، اما باید motivated بمانند.
سرپرست گفت که هر جزئیاتی مهم است.
